headline: Costco Switches Food Court Back to Coke After Decade With Pepsi
summary: Costco Wholesale Corporation (NASDAQ:COST) has ended its decade-long relationship with PepsiCo Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP), returning its food courts to products from Coca-Cola Co. (NYSE:KO). The transition began in late 2025 and was completed in early 2026. Costco has not provided extensive commentary on the change, but CEO Ron Vachris confirmed the switch back to Coca-Cola during the Q&A session of the company’s annual meeting. headline: Sam’s Club makes major product change as shoppers cut back
summary: Sam’s Club, which is operated by Walmart, has seen changing consumer behavior in recent months amid ongoing economic uncertainty, prompting shoppers to focus more on value as they rethink their spending habits.
